Class MainServerController

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.server.MainServerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualServer, Runnable, Remote
public class MainServerController extends Thread implements VirtualServer
Singleton class in charge of managing the opening and closing of lobbies, and the reception of each message to the respective lobby.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    Thread.Builder, Thread.State, Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static MainServerController getInstance()
      Main access method for the singleton object.
      Returns:
      MainServerController Instance of the singleton, if not present, constructs a new one.

    • reset

      public static void reset()
      Resets the singleton, mostly used during tests.

    • init

      public void init(String address, int tcpport, int rmiport)
      Initialize the MainServerController and the NetworkServer tied to it.
      Parameters:
      address - IP address on to which the server is opened.
      tcpport - Port used to open the ServerSocket.
      rmiport - Port used to open the RMI Registry.

    • run

      public void run()
      Main loop of the MainServerController class, retrieves messages from the queue and processes them.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • receiveMessage

      public void receiveMessage(ServerMessage message)
      Takes a ServerMessage and inserts it into the correct queue, either the lobby controller's or the main server controller's.
      Specified by:
      receiveMessage in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      message - ServerMessage Message to be added to the queue.

    • broadcast

      public void broadcast(ClientMessage message)
      Takes a ClientMessage and sends it to each connected listener not currently playing in a lobby.
      Parameters:
      message - ClientMessage Message to be broadcast.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(ClientDescriptor client, ClientMessage message)
      Takes a ClientMessage and sends it to a specific client.
      Parameters:
      message - ClientMessage Message to be sent.

    • getDescriptor

      public ClientDescriptor getDescriptor(String username)
      Returns the ClientDescriptor associated to a username.
      Parameters:
      username - Name corresponding to the client to fetch.
      Returns:
      ClientDescriptor Corresponding to the username, if present, if not returns null.

    • connectListener

      public void connectListener(SocketClient client)
      Connects a SocketClient to the server, and adds it to the list of sockets that need to complete their connection, starts a timeout timer in case they don't complete it in time.
      Parameters:
      client - SocketClient Socket connecting to the server

    • setupSocketListener

      public void setupSocketListener(SocketClient client, String username)
      Finalizes the connection of a SocketClient to the server by setting its username.
      Parameters:
      client - SocketClient Socket connecting to the server
      username - Username the client wishes to connect with.

    • connectListener

      public ClientDescriptor connectListener(RMIClientConnection client) throws RemoteException
      Connects an RMIClientConnection to the server
      Parameters:
      client - RMIClientConnection Client connecting to server.
      Returns:
      ClientDescriptor A ClientDescriptor tied to the RMI connection requesting it.
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • getStub

      public VirtualServer getStub(ClientDescriptor new_client) throws RemoteException
      Returns a RMIServerStubImpl linked to a ClientDescriptor for the RMIClientConnection to send messages with.
      Parameters:
      new_client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting the stub.
      Returns:
      VirtualServer A stub linked specifically to the client for it to communicate with the server.
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • validateUsername

      private boolean validateUsername(String username)
      Validates a username using a regex.
      Returns:
      Whether the username is valid or not.

    • connect

      public void connect(ClientDescriptor client) throws ForbiddenCallException
      Connects a ClientDescriptor to the lobby and adds it to any list it may belong to, or reconnects it to a ongoing game in case they belonged to it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting the connection.
      Throws:
      ForbiddenCallException - if for any reason connecting is forbidden

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(ClientDescriptor client)
      Disconnects a ClientDescriptor from the server and closes its connection, if the ClientDescriptor is connected to a lobby then the lobby handles whatever procedure may be needed.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client being disconnected.

    • addDisconnected

      public void addDisconnected(String username, int id)
      Adds an entry into the disconnected list for disconnection resilience purposes.
      Parameters:
      username - Name of the client disconnecting
      id - Id of the lobby they were in when playing.

    • removeDisconnected

      public void removeDisconnected(String username)
      Removes an entry from the disconnected list, either because of a reconnect or because of the game they belonged to closing.
      Parameters:
      username - Name of the client disconnecting

    • ping

      public void ping(ClientDescriptor client)
      Refreshes the timeout timer for a particular ClientDescriptor and restarts the timeout clock belonging to it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client pinging the server

    • TCPTimeoutTask

      private TimerTask TCPTimeoutTask(MainServerController controller, SocketClient client)
      Creates a timeout task for a SocketClient in its setup state, closing the connection and removing them from any list in case they don't setup in time.
      Parameters:
      controller - MainServerController Instance of the server to disconnect the client from.
      client - ClientDescriptor Client to be eventually timed out.

    • timeoutTask

      private TimerTask timeoutTask(MainServerController controller, ClientDescriptor client)
      Creates a timeout task for any ClientDescriptor, if the ClientDescriptor doesn't send a ping before it expires, task runs and disconnects the ClientDescriptor.
      Parameters:
      controller - MainServerController Instance of the server to disconnect the client from.
      client - ClientDescriptor Client to be eventually timed out.

    • getNext

      public int getNext()

    • updateUnfinishedList

      public void updateUnfinishedList()
      Updates the list of ModelInstance available for loading during creation of a lobby.

    • enterSetup

      public void enterSetup(ClientDescriptor client)
      Enters lobby setup state for a ClientDescriptor requesting it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting to enter the lobby creation and setup state.

    • leaveSetup

      public void leaveSetup(ClientDescriptor client)
      Leaves lobby setup state for a ClientDescriptor requesting it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting to leave the lobby creation and setup state.

    • openNewRoom

      public void openNewRoom(ClientDescriptor client, GameModeType type, PlayerCount count) throws ForbiddenCallException
      Opens a room with given type and size for a ClientDescriptor in setup state requesting it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting to open the lobby.
      type - GameModeType Gamemode of the lobby being opened.
      count - PlayerCount Size of the lobby being opened.
      Throws:
      ForbiddenCallException

    • openUnfinished

      public void openUnfinished(ClientDescriptor client, int id) throws ForbiddenCallException
      Opens a room tied to an unfinished game for a ClientDescriptor that requests it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting to open the lobby.
      id - ID of the saved game being opened.
      Throws:
      ForbiddenCallException - when the lobby is being opened in a forbidden or unsupported way.

    • lobbyCloseCleanup

      public void lobbyCloseCleanup(int id)
      Cleans up the lobby controller and all tied objects when a lobby closes.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the lobby being closed.

    • connectToLobby

      public void connectToLobby(ClientDescriptor client, int id) throws ForbiddenCallException
      Joins a lobby for a ClientDescriptor requesting it.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client requesting to join the lobby.
      id - ID of the lobby being joined
      Throws:
      ForbiddenCallException

    • notifyLobbyListeners

      public void notifyLobbyListeners()
      Notifies all ClientDescriptor in the lobby select screen with the new available lobby list.

    • getLobbyList

      public ArrayList<ClientGameListEntry> getLobbyList()

    • joinFromClosedLobby

      public void joinFromClosedLobby(ClientDescriptor client)
      Rejoins the lobby select screen after a lobby controller has closed.
      Parameters:
      client - ClientDescriptor Client being sent back to lobby select.
